name.baseName: Rotors production ; Rotors of 1.25MW wind turbines (24)
转子的制造;24个1.25 MW 风轮机转子的制造

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: The process described is the manufacturing of rotors for 1.25 MW wind turbines, specifically designed for a wind power system. This system is utilized to generate renewable energy through wind power, which is a critical component within large-scale wind farms. The rotors are part of an environmentally sustainable solution for electricity generation, aimed at replacing or supplementing traditional fossil fuel-based power plants.
本流程描述为1.25兆瓦风力发电机的转子制造过程，这些转子是风力发电系统中的关键部件，用于在大型风电场中通过风能生成可再生能源。转子是可持续电力生成方案的重要组成部分，旨在替代或补充传统的基于化石燃料的发电厂。

quantitativeReference.functionalUnitOrOther: The generation of 1 kW h (kW h) of electricity is adapted as the functional unit in this study, and the corresponding amounts of CO2 emissions and air pollutants (SO2,NOX and PM10)perkWh of electricity are chosen as the indicators for environmental performances, and the monetary value (US$) of per kW h of electricity is chosen as the indicator for cost-effectiveness evaluation.

locationOfOperationSupplyOrProduction.descriptionOfRestrictions: In this study, the typical wind farm system in Yulin City of Guangxi of Zhuang Autonomous Region China was selected as a case study site. The developer, namely, China Huadian Corporation, is a state-owned enterprise and devotes to develop wind power by providing wind power equipment and related service in China [37].
本研究选取中国广西壮族自治区玉林市的典型风电场系统作为案例研究地点。开发商即中国华电股份有限公司，是一家国有企业，通过提供风力发电设备及相关服务，致力于在中国发展风力发电[ 37 ]。

technology.technologicalApplicability: The process described is the manufacturing of rotors for 1.25 MW wind turbines, specifically designed for a wind power system. This system is utilized to generate renewable energy through wind power, which is a critical component within large-scale wind farms. The rotors are part of an environmentally sustainable solution for electricity generation, aimed at replacing or supplementing traditional fossil fuel-based power plants.
本流程描述为1.25兆瓦风力发电机的转子制造过程，这些转子是风力发电系统中的关键部件，用于在大型风电场中通过风能生成可再生能源。转子是可持续电力生成方案的重要组成部分，旨在替代或补充传统的基于化石燃料的发电厂。

LCIMethodAndAllocation.deviationsFromLCIMethodApproaches: According to Introduced by the life cycle assessment approach [34,35], firstly the system boundaries boundary of wind energy as well as and thermal power are first identified. Then, methodology on evaluating both environmental and economic benefits is presented so that co-benefits can be quantified followed by the introduction of the methodologies on environmental as well as economic impacts evaluation from the co-benefits perspective.
根据引入的生命周期评价方法[ 34、35 ]，首先确定了风能和火力发电的系统边界。然后，提出了评价环境和经济效益的方法，以量化共同利益，并从共同利益的角度介绍了环境和经济影响评价的方法。

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.dataSelectionAndCombinationPrinciples: This wind farm is equipped with 24 wind turbines, with a production capacity of 1.25 MW for each turbine, and t the operation life for each turbine is expected to be 20 years. The life cycle of one wind power system can be divided into five stages, including (1) production, (2) transportation and installation, (3) power generation, (4) maintenance, and (5) end-of-life recycling and disposal. The input of non-renewable energy has been shown in each stage. In this study, raw material, fossil fuel consumption and corresponding emissions have been taken into account of a life cycle process. Meanwhile, cost-effectiveness of a wind farm is considered because the cost plays a very important role in operating a wind farm [38]. Considering the data reliability and availability, the cost data of this wind farm was mainly extracted from a feasibility report of one wind farm (with a designed capacity of the 49.5 MW) in Kang ping County of Liaoning province [39].

该风电场装有24台风电机组，每台机组的生产能力为1.25 MW，预计每台机组的运行寿命为20年。风电系统的生命周期可分为5个阶段： (1)生产制造、 (2)运输和安装、 (3)发电、 (4)维护和 (5)报废回收和处置。不可再生能源的投入在各个阶段都有所体现。在这项研究中，原材料、化石燃料的消耗和相应的排放都考虑了一个生命周期过程。同时，考虑风电场的成本效益，因为成本在风电场运营中扮演着非常重要的角色[38]。考虑到数据的可靠性和可获得性，该风电场的成本数据主要取自辽宁省康平县某风电场(设计容量为49.5 MW)的可行性报告[39]
dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: Users of this LCA data should focus on the complete life cycle of the wind turbines, which includes production, transportation and installation, power generation, maintenance, and end-of-life stages. Attention must be given to the consumption of raw materials and fossil fuels, as well as the emissions related to the production and operation of the wind turbines. When evaluating the environmental and economic impacts, it is imperative to consider system boundaries and the methodologies introduced for impact assessment, ensuring the use of a consistent functional unit (kWh of electricity). Moreover, users should acknowledge the source and method of deriving cost data, as well as the context provided by the specific regional wind farm operational details for accurate LCA results.
使用此生命周期评价(LCA)数据的用户应关注风力发电机的完整生命周期，包括生产、运输安装、发电、维护和报废阶段。必须注意原材料和化石燃料的消耗，以及与风力发电机的生产和运行相关的排放。在评估环境和经济影响时，必须考虑系统边界和评估影响所引入的方法学，确保使用一致的功能单位（电力的千瓦时）。此外，用户应注意成本数据的来源和衍生方法，以及特定区域风电场运营细节提供的背景，以确保准确的LCA结果。

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.
清单： 内部审查通过几个迭代步骤完成，涉及原始数据验证、原始数据记录、代表性、完整性、与 ISO 14040 和 14044 有关的建模的一致性。

publicationAndOwnership.common:licenseType: Free of charge for all users and uses
